New Records: LeBron James broke loose against Sacramento with 32 points, 14 rebounds and 10 assists for his 113th career triple-double.
Kevin Durant scored 31 points to become the eighth player in NBA history to surpass 29,000 points.
Key Match Events: The Lakers averaged 121.3 points in the first three games under new coach JJ Redick.
James (6-for-6) and Davis (5-for-5) didn’t miss a shot in the 44-point fourth quarter that took the Lakers past the Kings.
Durant scored 31 points to become the eighth player in NBA history to surpass 29,000 points.
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers have won six of the past eight meetings.
Bradley Beal (elbow) missed Saturday’s game but is expected to return Monday.
Grayson Allen has missed the past two games for the birth of his daughter and he is slated to be available Monday.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Davis said after Saturday’s 131-127 victory over the Kings that the Lakers have been able to hold their own and put the league on notice that they’re a different team.
JJ Redick termed the final-quarter performance by James as “surreal.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers are starting a five-game road trip with the opener against the Phoenix Suns on Monday night.
Durant enters Monday’s game with 29,010 points, and the seven players ahead of him on the all-time scoring list are an elite list of basketball legends.
Others: The Lakers opened with three straight at home, beating the Minnesota Timberwolves, Suns and Sacramento Kings by an average of six points.
